COMMENT_TX: $Peter Kozma did not catch the throw, which glanced off the tip of his glove; 2B umpire Dana DeMuth ruled the play a catch and release and Dustin Pedroia left the field; Red Sox manager John Farrell argued the call with DeMuth and the six umpires huddled; the other five all agreed that the play was no catch and the call was reversed
$pitcher Adam Wainwright called for the popup in front of the mound; catcher Yadier Molina ran out to the area and Wainwright just stood there and let the ball drop
Cardinals right fielder Carlos Beltran left the game due to a right rib contusion suffered when he caught David Ortiz fly ball in the second and crashed into the bullpen wall

$with the infield in, Dustin Pedroia fielded the ball to his right and threw to HP for an out; Jarrod Saltalamacchia threw to 3B but the ball was on the fair side of the bag, struck the runner and skipped into LF foul territory; Will Middlebrooks fell trying to catch the throw; Allen Craig got up and started to run to HP but tripped over Middlebrooks' legs; Middlebrooks was called for obstruction and the play continued; Daniel Nava backed up the play and threw to HP in time to get Craig; however, Craig was allowed to score because of the obstruction
$the ninth consecutive time David Ortiz reached base in this World Series, tying a record
